When this register is 0, the threshold register function is invalid. Bits [7:5]: Priority threshold. Bits [4:0]: Reserved; always 0; invalid if writing.

bits_fields.name: NESTSTA
bits_fields.info: Current interrupt nesting status, supports 2-level nesting. [1:0] valid: 3: Level 2 interrupt in process; 1: Level 1 interrupt in process; 0: No interrupt occurs; Others: Impossible condition.

bits_fields.name: SEVONPEND
bits_fields.description: Setting a new interrupt into the pending state as a wakeup event allows you to wake up the system after a WFE instruction, or immediately after the next execution of the instruction. 1: New interrupt enters pending state as wake-up event; 0: Does not.

bits_fields.name: WFITOWFE
bits_fields.description: The WFI command is executed as WFE. 1: subsequent WFI command is deemed WFE; 0: No action.

bits_fields.name: SLEEPDEEP
bits_fields.description: Low-power mode control: 1 = deep sleep; 0 = sleep.

bits_fields.name: SLEEPONEXIT
bits_fields.description: Controls system status after interrupt service routine: 1 = system enters low-power mode; 0 = system goes to main program.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: STCLK

bits_fields.name: STIE
bits_fields.description: Counter interrupt enable: 1 enables interrupt; 0 no interrupt.

bits_fields.name: STE
bits_fields.description: System counter enable: 1 enables system counter STK; 0 disables system counter and stops counting.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Software interrupt (SWI) trigger enable: 1 triggers software interrupt; 0 turns off trigger. Note: Must be cleared after entering SWI to avoid continuous trigger.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: CNTIF
bits_fields.description: Count value compare flag; writing 0 clears flag, writing 1 invalid. Flag indicates: 1 = upcount to comparison value then downcount to 0; 0 = not reached comparison value.

bits_fields.name: CNTL
bits_fields.description: STK counter count value lower 32 bits.

bits_fields.name: CMPL
bits_fields.description: Set reloaded counter value lower 32 bits.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_LONG_RST_EN
bits_fields.description: Long reset enable.

bits_fields.name: R8_SAFE_ACCESS_S
bits_fields.description: Secure access sign register. Writing sequence 0x57 then 0xA8 enters secure access mode for about 112 clock cycles. Writing any other value exits secure mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_CHIP_ID1
bits_fields.description: Chip type identification bit 1.

bits_fields.name: RB_SAFE_ACC_TIMER_X
bits_fields.description: Current safe access time count.

bits_fields.name: RB_SAFE_ACC_ACT
bits_fields.description: Current secure access mode status: 1 = unlocked/writable; 0 = locked (RWA registers protected).

bits_fields.name: RB_CHIP_ID0
bits_fields.description: Chip type identification bit 0.

bits_fields.name: RB_SAFE_ACC_MODE
bits_fields.description: Current safe access mode status: 11 indicates safe mode (RWA writable), others non-secure mode.

bits_fields.name: R8_CHIP_ID
bits_fields.description: Chip identification code. Fixed values: CH585 = 0x93, CH584 = 0x92, CH585C = 0x91.

bits_fields.name: R8_SAFE_ACCESS_ID
bits_fields.description: Fixed reset value register indicating safe access ID with value 0x0C.

bits_fields.name: R8_WDOG_COUNT
bits_fields.description: Watchdog counter with preset initial value, which increases automatically continuously. It cycles from 0xFF to 0x00 then continues. Counting period is 131072/Fsys.

bits_fields.name: RB_ROM_CODE_WE
bits_fields.description: Erase/program enable bit of FlashROM program storage area CodeFlash: 00 = Write-protect all; 01 = Permit erasing 129K-240K; 11 = Permit erasing 0-240K.

bits_fields.name: RB_ROM_CODE_WE
bits_fields.description: Erase/program enable bit of FlashROM code storage area CodeFlash (0-128K): 1 = Allow erasing/programming; 0 = Write-protected.

bits_fields.name: RB_ROM_DATA_WE
bits_fields.description: Erase/program enable bit of FlashROM data storage area CodeFlash (0-240K): 1 = Allow erasing/programming; 0 = Write-protected.

bits_fields.name: RB_ROM_CTRL_EN
bits_fields.description: FlashROM access control interface enable: 1 = Allow control.

bits_fields.name: RB_ROM_CODE_OFS
bits_fields.description: Starting offset address select for user program code in FlashROM: 0 = 0x000000; 1 = 0x040000 (skip first 256KB).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_RESET_FLAG
bits_fields.description: Last reset status: 000 = Software reset SR; 001 = Power-on reset RPOR; 010 = Watchdog timeout reset; 011 = External manual reset MR; 101 = Reset GRWSM from power-down wake-up; 100/110/111 = Wake-up reset LRW.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_BOOT_LOADER
bits_fields.description: Bootloader status: 1 means currently in bootloader; 0 means currently in user program.

bits_fields.name: RB_CFG_DEBUG_EN
bits_fields.description: Simulation debug interface enable: 1 enables FlashROM read and debug; 0 disables.

bits_fields.name: RB_CFG_BOOT_EN
bits_fields.description: System bootloader enable status: 1 enabled; 0 disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_CFG_RESET_EN

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_WDOG_INT_FLAG
bits_fields.description: Watchdog timer interrupt flag: 1 indicates watchdog count overflow (R8_WDOG_COUNT wrapped from 0xFF to 0x00); 0 indicates no overflow. Write 1 or reload R8_WDOG_COUNT or execute SETEVENT to clear.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_WDOG_INT_EN
bits_fields.description: Watchdog timer interrupt enable: 1 enables interrupt generation after watchdog count overflow; 0 disables interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_WDOG_RST_EN
bits_fields.description: Watchdog timeout reset enable bit: 1 = Enable system reset after watchdog count overflow; 0 = Only use as a timer. Note: Once set to 1, software resets do not affect RB_RESET_FLAG.

bits_fields.name: RB_SOFTWARE_RESET
bits_fields.description: System software reset control: Write 1 to perform software reset; 0 means no action. This bit clears automatically after reset.

bits_fields.name: R8_GLOB_RESET_KEEP
bits_fields.description: Reset keep register. Its value is not affected by manual reset, software reset, watchdog reset, or ordinary wake-up reset. Only cleared by power-on reset or GRWSM.

bits_fields.name: RB_SLP_CLK_PWMX

bits_fields.name: RB_SLP_CLK_SPI0

bits_fields.name: RB_SLP_GPIO_WAKE

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_PLAN_EN
bits_fields.description: Sleep power planning control enable: 1: Enable planning; 0: Disable or end planning. The power planning is enabled for execution when entering sleep or power-off mode later, and this bit is automatically cleared after execution.]

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_LDO_EN

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_SYS_EN

bits_fields.description: Reserved, 0 must be written.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.]

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_EXTEND
bits_fields.description: USB and RF configuration power supply (sleep planning): 1: Dual power; 0: No auxiliary power.]

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_CORE
bits_fields.description: Power of the core and basic peripherals (sleep planning): 1: Dual power; 0: No auxiliary power.]

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_RAM32K
bits_fields.description: SRAM power supply of RAM32K (sleep planning): 1: Dual power; 0: No auxiliary power.]

bits_fields.name: RB_PWR_XROM
bits_fields.description: FlashROM power supply (sleep planning): 1: Continuous power; 0: Power off during sleep.]

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: Reserved

bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: Reserved

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_BAT_LOWER_IE

bits_fields.name: RB_BAT_DET_EN

Reserved

bits_fields.description: RC32K adjustment bit, internal 32KHz oscillator bias current selection: 00: 70% of rated current; 01: Rated current; 10: 140% of rated current; 11: 200% of rated current. Note: The current can be changed to the rated current after the crystal oscillator is stable.

bits_fields.name: RB_XT32K_I_TUNE
bits_fields.description: External 32KHz oscillator bias current select: 00: 70% of rated current; 01: Rated current; 10: 140% of rated current; 11: 200% of rated current. Note: The current can be changed to the rated current after the crystal oscillator is stable.

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_CLK_INT32K_PON

bits_fields.name: RB_CLK_XT32K_PON
bits_fields.description: External 32KHz oscillator power control bit: 1: Power on; 0: Power down.

bits_fields.name: RB_XT32M_C_LOAD
bits_fields.description: Select the built-in load capacitance that matches the external 32MHz crystal (May affect wireless communication): [7] = 0: Capacitance = RB_XT32M_C_LOAD*2 + 10pF; [7] = 1: capacitance = RB_XT32M_C_LOAD*2 + 2pF. Therefore, 0000b~0111b corresponds to about 10pF to 24pF, and 1000b~1111b corresponds to about 2pF to 16pF. Select according to the parameters of the crystal used, and 0111b is commonly used.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_XT32M_I_BIAS
bits_fields.description: External 32MHz oscillator bias current selected: 00: 75% of rated current; 01: Rated current; 10: 125% of rated current; 11: 150% of rated current.

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CAL_IF

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CAL_OV_CLR

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CAL_CNT

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CAL_OV_CNT
bits_fields.description: Oscillator frequency calibration count overflow times, write 1 to RB_OSC_CAL_OV_CLR to clear this register.

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CNT_END

bits_fields.description: Oscillator frequency calibration counter enable: 1: Enable counting; 0: Disable counting.

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CAL_IE
bits_fields.description: Oscillator capture complete interrupt enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CNT_HALT

bits_fields.name: RB_OSC_CNT_TOTAL
bits_fields.description: Oscillator capture total cycle selection: 000: 1 cycle; 001: 2 cycles; 010: 4 cycles; 011: 32 cycles; 100: 64 cycles; 101: 128 cycles; 110: 1024 cycles; 111: 2047 cycles.

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TRIG_FLAG

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_FLAG
bits_fields.description: RTC timing mode activation flag.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TRIG_CLR
bits_fields.description: This bit is always 1 when the trigger mode is disabled. When the trigger mode is enabled, write 1, clear the trigger mode activation flag RB_RTC_TRIG_FLAG and automatically cleared to 0.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_CLR
bits_fields.description: When the timing mode is disabled, this bit is fixed as 1. When the timing mode is enabled, write 1, clear the timing mode activation flag RB_RTC_TMR_FLAG and automatically cleared to 0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_LOAD_HI
bits_fields.description: Write 1 to load the high word of RTC counter, and automatically cleared to 0 after loading. Load R32_RTC_TRIG (Actually only the low 14 bits) to R32_RTC_CNT_DAY.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_LOAD_LO
bits_fields.description: Write 1 to load the low word of RTC counter, and automatically cleared after loading. Load the high 16 bits of R32_RTC_TRIG to R16_RTC_CNT_2S; load the low 16 bits of R32_RTC_TRIG to R16_RTC_CNT_32K.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TRIG_EN
bits_fields.description: RTC trigger mode enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_EN
bits_fields.description: RTC timing mode enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_IGNORE_B0
bits_fields.description: Ignore and compare the lowest bit of matching value in trigger mode: 1: Ignore the lowest bit; 0: Compare the lowest bit.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_MODE
R32_RTC_TRIG
bits_fields.description: The preset matching value in RTC trigger mode, and the high 16 bits and low 16 bits are matched with R16_RTC_CNT_2S and R16_RTC_CNT_32K respectively. Cooperate with RB_RTC_LOAD_LO and RB_RTC_LOAD_HI to update the current value of RTC counter.

bits_fields.name: R16_RTC_CNT_32K
bits_fields.description: RTC count value register based on 32768Hz.

R16_RTC_CNT_2S.name: R16_RTC_CNT_2S

bits_fields.name: R16_RTC_CNT_2S

R32_RTC_CNT_DAY.name: R32_RTC_CNT_DAY

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.info: Description Reset value Half-duplex transceiver mode control (only supported by UART0): 1: Enter half-duplex transceiver mode, transmit with priority, and receive when not transmitting; 0: Disable half-duplex mode.]

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_TNOW
bits_fields.info: Status enable that DTR pin output is being transmitted (only supported by UART0): 1: Output the indication status of being transmitted to DTR pin, used to control the RS485 receive/transmit switch. 0: DTR pin is in normal function.]

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_AU_FLOW_EN
bits_fields.info: CTS and RTS hardware automatic flow control enable (only supported by UART0): 1: Enable; 0: Disable; In the flow control mode, if this bit is 1, then UART will continue to send the next data only when it detects that the CTS pin input is valid (active low). Otherwise, the UART transmission will be suspended, and the CTS input status change will not generate MODEM status interrupt when this bit is 1. If this bit is 1 and RTS is 1, UART will automatically validate the RTS pin (active low) when receiver FIFO is empty. UART will automatically invalidate the RTS pin when the number of received bytes reaches the trigger point of FIFO and will re-validate the RTS pin when the receiver FIFO is empty. Hardware automatic flow control can be used to connect your own CTS pin to the other party's RTS pin and transmit your own RTS pin to the other party's CTS pin.]

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_RESET
bits_fields.info: UART software reset control bit, automatically cleared: 1: Software resets UART; 0: Normal operation.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_DTR_EN

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_MODEM_CHG

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_LINE_STAT

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_THR_EMPTY

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_RECV_RDY
bits_fields.info: Receive data interrupt enable bit: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_FIFO_TRIG
bits_fields.info: Trigger points select of receiving FIFO interrupt and hardware flow control: 00: 1 byte; 01: 2 bytes; 10: 4 bytes; 11: 7 bytes. Used to set the trigger points of receiving FIFO interrupt and hardware flow control. For example: 10 corresponds to 4 bytes, that is, interrupt available for receiving data is generated when 4 bytes are received, and RTS pin is automatically invalidated when hardware flow control is enabled.

bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_TX_FIFO_CLR
bits_fields.info: Transmit FIFO data clear enable bit, and automatically cleared: 1: Clear the data of transmitter FIFO (excluding TSR); 0: Not clear the data of transmitter FIFO.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_RX_FIFO_CLR
bits_fields.info: Receive FIFO data clear enable bit, and automatically cleared: 1: Clear the data of receiver FIFO (excluding RSR); 0: Not clear the data of receiver FIFO.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_FIFO_EN
bits_fields.info: FIFO enable bit: 1: Enable 8-byte FIFO; 0: Disable FIFO. After disabling FIFO, it is 1650 compatible mode, which means that there is only 1 byte in FIFO (RECV_TG1=0, RECV_TG0=0, FIFO_EN=1), and it is recommended to enable.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_DLAB
bits_fields.info: UART divisor latch access bit for baud rate configuration.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_BREAK_EN
bits_fields.info: Force to generate BREAK line interval enable: 1: Forced to generate; 0: Not generate.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_PAR_MOD
bits_fields.info: Parity bit format selection: 00: Odd; 01: Even; 10: Mark (set to 1); 11: Space (cleared). Valid only when RB_LCR_PAR_EN is 1.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_PAR_EN
bits_fields.info: Parity bit enable: 1: Allow to generate parity bit when transmitting and check parity bit when receiving; 0: No parity bit.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_STOP_BIT
bits_fields.info: Stop bit format set: 1: 2 stop bits; 0: 1 stop bit.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_WORD_SZ
bits_fields.info: UART data length selection: 00: 5 data bits; 01: 6 data bits; 10: 7 data bits; 11: 8 data bits.

bits_fields.name: RB_IIR_FIFO_ID
bits_fields.info: UART FIFO enable status: 11: FIFO has been enabled; 00: FIFO is not enabled.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_IIR_INT_MASK
bits_fields.info: Interrupt flag: If the RB_IIR_NO_INT bit is 0, an interrupt is generated, and it is needed to judge the interrupt source after reading.

bits_fields.name: RB_IIR_NO_INT
bits_fields.info: UART no interrupt flag: 1 indicates no interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_ERR_RX_FIFO
bits_fields.info: Receive FIFO error flag: 1: At least one PAR_ERR or FRAM_ERR or BREAK_ERR error in the receiver FIFO; 0: No error in receiver FIFO.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_TX_ALL_EMP
bits_fields.info: THR and TSR empty flag: 1: Both are empty; 0: Both are not empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_TX_FIFO_EMP
bits_fields.info: Transmit FIFO empty flag: 1: Transmit FIFO is empty; 0: Transmit FIFO is not empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_BREAK_ERR
bits_fields.info: BREAK line interval detection flag: 1: BREAK is detected; 0: BREAK is not detected.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_FRAME_ERR
bits_fields.info: Data frame error flag: 1: Frame error in the data being read from the receiver FIFO, and a valid stop bit is missing; 0: No error in the currently read data frame.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_PAR_ERR
bits_fields.info: Receive data Parity error flag: 1: Parity error in the data being read from the receiver FIFO; 0: The currently read data parity is correct.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_OVER_ERR
bits_fields.info: Receiver FIFO buffer overflow flag.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_DATA_RDY
bits_fields.info: Receiver FIFO receive data flag: 1: Data in FIFO; 0: No data. After reading all the data in the FIFO, this bit will be automatically cleared.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_RBR
bits_fields.info: Data receive buffer register. If the DATA_RDY bit of LSR is 1, the received data can be read from this register; if FIFO_EN is 1, the data received from UART shift register RSR will be firstly stored in the receiver FIFO, and then read out through the register.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_THR
bits_fields.info: Transmit hold register. Transmitter FIFO is included, used to write the data to be transmitted; if FIFO_EN is 1, the written data will be firstly stored in the transmitter FIFO, and then output one by one through the transmit shift register TSR.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_RFC
bits_fields.info: Data count in the current receiver FIFO.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_TFC
bits_fields.info: Data count in the current transmitter FIFO.

bits_fields.name: R16_UARTx_DL
bits_fields.info: The 16-bit divisor is used to calculate the baud rate. Formula: Divisor = the serial internal reference clock Fuart / 16 / the required communication baud rate. For example: If the serial internal reference clock Fuart is 1.8432 MHz and the required baud rate is 9600 bps, then the divisor = 1843200/16/9600=12.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_DIV
bits_fields.info: Used to calculate the internal reference clock of UART, the lower 7 bits are valid. Formula: Divisor = Fsys*2 / internal reference clock of UART, the maximum value is 127.

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DCD
bits_fields.info: DCD pin status: 1: DCD is active (low level); 0: DCD is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_RI
bits_fields.info: RI pin status: 1: RI is active (low level); 0: RI is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DSR
bits_fields.info: DSR pin status: 1: DSR pin is active (low level); 0: DSR pin is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_CTS
bits_fields.info: CTS pin status: 1: CTS pin is active (low level); 0: CTS pin is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DCD_CHG
bits_fields.info: DCD input status change flag: 1: Has changed; 0: No change.

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_RI_CHG
bits_fields.info: RI input status change flag: 1: Has changed; 0: No change.

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DSR_CHG
bits_fields.info: DSR pin input status change flag: 1: Has changed; 0: No change.

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_CTS_CHG
bits_fields.info: CTS pin input status change flag: 1: Has changed; 0: No change.

bits_fields.name: R8_UART0_ADR
bits_fields.info: Slave address of UART0 during multi-device communication: FFh: Not used; Others: Slave address.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MISO_OE
bits_fields.info: MISO pin output enable (can be used at data line switching direction in 2-wire mode): 1: MISO output enabled; 0: MISO output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MOSI_OE
bits_fields.info: MOSI pin output enable: 1: MOSI output enabled; 0: MOSI output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SCK_OE
bits_fields.info: SCK pin output enable: 1: SCK output enabled; 0: SCK output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_FIFO_DIR
bits_fields.info: FIFO direction: 1: Input (receive data); 0: Output (transmit data).

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_CMD_MOD
bits_fields.info: First byte mode selection in SPI0 slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1: First byte command mode; 0: Data stream mode. In the first byte command mode, it will be regarded as a command code when receiving the first byte of data after the SPI chip select is valid and RB_SPI_IF_FST_BYTE will be set to 1.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MST_SCK_MOD
bits_fields.info: Clock idle mode selection in master mode: 1: Mode3 (SCK is at high level when idle); 0: Mode0 (SCK is at low level when idle).

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_2WIRE_MOD
bits_fields.info: 2-wire or 3-wire SPI mode selection in slave mode: 1: 2-wire mode/half duplex (SCK/MISO); 0: 3-wire mode/full duplex (SCK/MOSI/MISO).

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_ALL_CLEAR
bits_fields.info: SPI FIFO/counter/interrupt flag clear: 1: Force to empty and clear; 0: Not clear.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MODE_SLAVE
bits_fields.info: SPI0 master/slave mode selection (only supported by SPI0): 1: Slave mode; 0: Master mode.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MST_DLY_EN
bits_fields.info: Input delay enable in master mode: 1: Enable, used for high-speed applications such as SPI clock close to half of Fsys; 0: Disable, regular applications.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_BIT_ORDER
bits_fields.info: SPI data bit order selection: 1: LSB first, 0: MSB first.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_AUTO_IF
bits_fields.info: Enable the function of automatically clearing flag RB_SPI_IF_BYTE_END when accessing BUFFER/FIFO: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_DMA_LOOP
bits_fields.info: DMA address loop enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable address loop; 0: Disable address loop. If the DMA address loop is enabled, when the DMA address is added to the set end address, the auto loop points to the set first address.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_DMA_ENABLE
bits_fields.info: DMA enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_FST_BYTE
bits_fields.info: In the first byte command mode of slave mode, first byte interrupt receive enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable receiving the first byte interrupt; 0: Disable receiving the first byte interrupt.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: FIFO overflow (FIFO is full when receiving, or FIFO is empty when transmitting) interrupt enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable; 0: Disable.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA end interrupt enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_FIFO_HF
bits_fields.info: More than half of FIFO used interrupt enable: 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_BYTE_END
bits_fields.info: SPI single byte transmission completion interrupt enable: 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_CNT_END
bits_fields.info: SPI all byte transmission completion interrupt enable: 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.]

bits_fields.name: R8_SPI_CLOCK_DIV
bits_fields.info: Frequency division factor in master mode, the minimum value is 2, up to 254. Fsck= Fsys/frequency division factor.]

bits_fields.name: R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE
bits_fields.info: Preset data first returned in slave mode. Used to receive the returned data after first byte of data.]

bits_fields.name: R8_SPIx_BUFFER
bits_fields.info: SPI data transmit and receive buffer.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_SELECT
bits_fields.info: Chip select status in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1: Being selected; 0: No chip selected.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_CS_LOAD
bits_fields.info: First loading status after chip select in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1: Being loading R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE; 0: Not loading.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_FIFO_READY
bits_fields.info: FIFO ready: 1: FIFO is ready (R16_SPIx_TOTAL_CNT is not 0, and the FIFO is not full when receiving or the FIFO is not empty when transmitting); 0: FIFO is not ready.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_CMD_ACT
bits_fields.info: Command received completion status in slave mode, that is, completing the exchange of first byte data (only supported by SPI0): 1: That has just been exchanged is the first byte; 0: The first byte has not been exchanged or it is not the first byte.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_FST_BYTE
bits_fields.info: First byte received flag in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1: The first byte has been received; 0: The first byte is not received.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_FREE
bits_fields.info: Current SPI free: 1: Free; 0: Not free.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: FIFO overflow (FIFO is full when receiving or FIFO is empty when transmitting) flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: Overflow; 0: Not overflow.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA end flag (only supported by SPI0). Write 1 to reset: 1: End; 0: Not end.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_FIFO_HF
bits_fields.info: More than half of FIFO used (FIFO>=4 when receiving or FIFO<4 when transmitting) flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: More than half of FIFO has been used; 0: FIFO has been used not more than half.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_BYTE_END
bits_fields.info: SPI single byte transfer end flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: End; 0: Not end.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_CNT_END
bits_fields.info: SPI all byte transfer end flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: All byte transfer ends; 0: All byte transfer not end.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R8_SPIx_FIFO_COUNT
bits_fields.info: Current byte count in FIFO.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPIx_TOTAL_CNT
bits_fields.info: Total number of bytes of SPI data sent and received in host mode, with the lower 12 bits valid. Up to 4095 bytes can be sent and received at one time when using DMA. Slave mode is not supported.]

bits_fields.name: R8_SPIx_FIFO
bits_fields.info: Data FIFO register.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R8_SPI0_FIFO_COUNT1
bits_fields.info: Current byte count in FIFO. The same as R8_SPIx_FIFO_COUNT.]

R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE.name: R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE
R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE.info: SPI0 clock divider register in master mode SPI0 preset data register in slave mode

R16_SPI0_TOTAL_CNT.name: R16_SPI0_TOTAL_CNT
R16_SPI0_TOTAL_CNT.info: SPI0 transceiver data total length register

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_NOW
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer current address. It can be used to calculate the number of conversions. COUNT=SPI0_DMA_NOW-SPI0_DMA_BEG.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_BEG
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer start address.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer end address (not included)

R8_SPI1_CLOCK_DIV.name: R8_SPI1_CLOCK_DIV
R8_SPI1_CLOCK_DIV.info: SPI1 clock divider register in master mode

R16_SPI1_TOTAL_CNT.name: R16_SPI1_TOTAL_CNT
R16_SPI1_TOTAL_CNT.info: SPI0 transceiver data total length register

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM11_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM11 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM10_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM10 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM9_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM9 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM8_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM8 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM7_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM7 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM6_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM6 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM5_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM5 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM4_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM4 output enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM11_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM11 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM10_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM10 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM9_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM9 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM8_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM8 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM7_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM7 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM6_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM6 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM5_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM5 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM4_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM4 output polarity control: 1: Default at high level, active low; 0: Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM10_11_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM10/11 interleaved output enable: 1: Interleaved output; 0: Independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM8_9_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM8/9 interleaved output enable: 1: Interleaved output; 0: Independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM6_7_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM6/7 interleaved output enable: 1: Interleaved output; 0: Independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM4_5_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM4/5 interleaved output enable: 1: Interleaved output; 0: Independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_CYC_MOD
bits_fields.info: PWM data width selection: 00: 8-bit data width; 01: 7-bit data width; 10: 6-bit data width; 11: 16-bit data width.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_STAG_ST
bits_fields.info: PWM interleave flag: 1: PWM5/7/9/11 is allowed to output; 0: PWM4/6/8/10 is allowed to output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_CYCLE_SEL
bits_fields.info: PWM period selection: 0: 8/7/6-bit data width corresponding to 256/128/64 clock cycles; the 16-bit data width corresponds to clock cycles controlled by R32_PWM_REG_CYCLE.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM_CLOCK_DIV
bits_fields.info: PWM reference clock frequency division factor. Fpwm=Fsys/R8_PWM_CLOCK_DIV.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM7_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM7 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM6_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM6 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM5_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM5 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM4_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM4 data hold register.

bits_fields.info: PWM11 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM10_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM10 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM9_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM9 data hold register.

bits_fields.info: PWM8 data hold register.

bits_fields.info: PWM7 data hold register (16-bit width).

R8_PWM_INT_CTRL.info: PWMx interrupt control and status register

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_IF_CYC
bits_fields.info: PWM cycle end flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: End; 0: Not end.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_CYC_PRE
bits_fields.info: Select the interrupt time point at the end of PWM cycle: 1: Interrupt is generated 16 counts in advance (example for 8-bit width, interrupt at count 240); 0: Interrupt is generated 2 counts in advance (example for 8-bit width, interrupt at count 254).

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_IE_CYC
bits_fields.info: PWM cycle end interrupt enable: 1: Enabled; 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM9_REG_DATA
bits_fields.info: 16-bit bit data of PWM9 channel.

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM8_REG_DATA
bits_fields.info: 16-bit bit data of PWM8 channel.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SWRST
bits_fields.info: Software reset. When user codes set this bit, I2C is reset. Before reset, make sure that IIC lines are released and the bus is idle.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: This bit can reset I2C when no Stop condition is detected on the bus but the busy bit is 1.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ALERT
bits_fields.info: SMBus alert. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. After the PE bit is set, this bit can be cleared by hardware. 1: Drive SMBusALERT pin low, response address header followed by ACK; 0: Release SMBusALERT pin high, response address header followed by NACK.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_PEC
bits_fields.info: Data packet error checking enable. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. After PEC is transmitted, or when a Start or Stop condition is generated, or when the PE bit is cleared to 0, this bit is cleared by hardware. 1: PEC enabled; 0: PEC disabled. Note: PEC is corrupted when an arbitration is lost.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_POS
bits_fields.info: ACK/PEC position. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes or cleared by hardware after PE is cleared. 1: The ACK bit controls ACK/NAK of the next byte received in the shift register, which is a PEC; 0: The ACK bit controls ACK/NAK of the current byte being received in the shift register which may be a PEC. Note: The POS bit is used for reception of 2-byte data and must be configured before reception.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ACK
bits_fields.info: Acknowledge enable. Can be set or cleared by user codes or cleared by hardware after PE is set. 1: Acknowledge returned after a byte is received; 0: No acknowledge.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_STOP
bits_fields.info: Stop condition generation. Can be set or cleared by user codes or cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected or set by hardware when a timeout error occurs. Master mode: 1 generates Stop during or after Start; 0 no Stop generated. Slave mode: 1 releases SCL and SDA after byte transmission; 0 no Stop generated.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_START
bits_fields.info: Start condition generation. Can be set or cleared by user codes or cleared by hardware when a Start is sent or PE is cleared. Master mode: 1 repeated Start; 0 no Start. Slave mode: 1 Start generated when bus is idle; 0 no Start.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_NOSTRETCH
bits_fields.info: Clock stretching disable. Disable clock stretching when ADDB or BTF flag is set until cleared by software. 1 disables; 0 enables clock stretching.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ENGC
bits_fields.info: General call enable. Set to enable general call response address 00h.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ENPEC
bits_fields.info: PEC enable. Can be set to enable PEC calculation.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ENARP
bits_fields.info: ARP enable. Set to enable ARP. If SMBTYPE=0, use default SMBus device address; if SMBTYPE=1, use SMBus host address.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SMBTYPE
bits_fields.info: SMBus device type: 1 SMBus host; 0 SMBus device.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SMBUS
bits_fields.info: SMBus mode selection: 1 SMBus mode; 0 I2C mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_PE
bits_fields.info: I2C peripheral enable: 1 enabled; 0 disabled.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ITBUFEN
bits_fields.info: Buffer interrupt enable. 1: When TxE or RxNE is set, event interrupt is generated; 0: no interrupt is generated.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ITEVTEN
bits_fields.info: Event interrupt enable. The interrupt is generated when: SB=1 (Master); ADDR=1 (Master/Slave); ADDR10=1 (Master); STOPF=1 (Slave); BTF=1 with no TxE or RxNE events; TxE event when ITBUFEN=1; RxNE event when ITBUFEN=1.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ITERREN
bits_fields.info: Error interrupt enable. Interrupt generated on: BERR=1; ARLO=1; AF=1; OVR=1; PECERR=1; TIMEOUT=1; SMBAlert=1.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_FREQ
bits_fields.info: I2C clock frequency. Allowed range is 2~36 MHz. Bits must be set between 000010b and 100100b. Unit is MHz. Recommended minimum: 2 MHz for standard mode; 4 MHz for fast mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADDMODE
bits_fields.info: Addressing mode. 1: 10-bit slave address (7-bit address not acknowledged); 0: 7-bit slave address (10-bit address not acknowledged).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADD9_8
bits_fields.info: Bus address bits 9-8 when using 10-bit address. Ignored when using 7-bit address.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADD7_1
bits_fields.info: Bus address bits 7-1.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADD0
bits_fields.info: Bus address bit 0 when using 10-bit address. Ignored when using 7-bit address.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADD2
bits_fields.info: Bus address, bits7-1 in dual addressing mode

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ENDUAL
bits_fields.info: Dual addressing mode enable bit. This bit can be set to make ADD2 recognized

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_DATAR
bits_fields.info: Data register. It can be used to store the received data or store the data to be sent to the bus

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SMBALE
bits_fields.info: SMBus alert. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. In SMBus host mode: 1: SMBus alert occurs; 0: No SMBus alert. In SMBus slave mode: 1: SMBAlert response address header to SMBAlert LOW received; 0: No SMBAlert response address header received.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_TIMEOUT
bits_fields.info: Timeout or Tlow error flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1: SCL remained LOW for 25mS, or master low extend time more than 10mS, or slave low extend time more than 25mS; 0: No timeout error. Note: When this bit is set in slave mode, the slave device will reset the communication and the hardware will release the bus; when this bit is set in master mode, the hardware will issue a stop condition.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_PECERR
bits_fields.info: PEC error flag in reception. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1: PEC error, NAK returned after PEC is received; 0: No PEC error.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_OVR
bits_fields.info: Overrun/Underrun flag. 1: Overrun/Underrun: If NOSTRETCH=1, when a new byte is received in reception and data register has not been read, the new received byte is lost. In transmission, when no new data is written into data register, the same byte is sent twice; 0: No overrun/underrun.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_AF
bits_fields.info: Acknowledge failure flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1: Acknowledge failure; 0: No acknowledge failure.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ARLO
bits_fields.info: Arbitration lost flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1: Arbitration lost detected, the interface loses the control to the bus; 0: Arbitration is normal.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_BERR
bits_fields.info: Bus error flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1: Start/Stop condition error; 0: Normal.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_TxE
bits_fields.info: Data register empty flag. It can be cleared by writing data to the data register, or it can be cleared by hardware after a Start/Stop condition is generated or when PE is 0. 1: Data register empty in transmission; 0: Data register not empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_RxNE
bits_fields.info: Data register not empty flag. It can be cleared by reading/writing data to the data register, or it can be cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1: Data register not empty in reception; 0: Normal.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_STOPF
bits_fields.info: Stop condition flag. It can be cleared by write operation to the control register1 after user reads the status register1, or it can be cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1: Slave detects a Stop condition on the bus after an acknowledge; 0: No Stop condition detected.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADD10
bits_fields.info: 10-bit address header sent flag. It can be cleared by write operation to the control register1 after user reads the status register1, or it can be cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1: In 10-bit addressing mode, slave has sent the first address byte; 0: None.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_BTF
bits_fields.info: Byte transmission finished flag. It can be cleared by read/write operation to the data register after user reads the status register1. In transmission, it can be cleared by hardware after a Start/Stop condition is generated or when PE is 0. 1: Byte transmission finished. If NOSTRETCH=0: in transmission, when a new data is sent and no new data is written into the data register; in reception, when a new byte is received but the data register has not been read; 0: None.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_ADDR
bits_fields.info: Address sent/matched flag. It can be cleared by read operation to the status register2 after user reads the status register1, or it can be cleared by hardware when PE is 0. In master mode: 1: Address transmission finished: in 10-bit addressing mode, this bit is set after ACK of the second address byte is received; in 7-bit addressing mode, this bit is set after ACK of the byte is received; 0: Address transmission not finished. In slave mode: 1: Received address matched; 0: Address not matched or no address received.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SB
bits_fields.info: Start bit sent flag. It can be cleared by write operation to the data register after user reads the status register1, or it can be cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1: Start bit sent; 0: Start bit not sent.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_PEC
bits_fields.info: Packet error checking register. When PEC is enabled (ENPEC is set), this register stores the value of PEC.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_DUALF
bits_fields.info: Dual flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1: Received address matched with OADDR2; 0: Received address matched with OADDR1.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SMBHOST
bits_fields.info: SMBus host header flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1: When SMBTYPE=1 and ENARP=1, SMBus host address received; 0: SMBus host address not received.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_SMBDEFAULT
bits_fields.info: SMBus device default address flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1: When ENARP=1, SMBus device default address received; 0: SMBus device default address not received.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_GENCALL
bits_fields.info: General call address flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1: When ENGC=1, general call address received; 0: General call address not received.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_TRA
bits_fields.info: Transmission/reception flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected (STOPF=1) or repeated Start condition is detected or an arbitration lost is detected (ARLO=1) or when PE=0. 1: Data transmitted; 0: Data received. This bit is determined by the R/W bit of the address byte.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_BUSY
bits_fields.info: Bus busy flag. It can be cleared when a Stop condition is detected. When the interface is disabled (PE=0), the information is still updated. 1: Busy bus: SDA or SCL LOW; 0: Idle bus, and no communication.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_MSL
bits_fields.info: Master/slave mode indication. It can be cleared by hardware when the interface is in Master mode (SB=1). It can be cleared by hardware when the bus detects a Stop bit or an arbitration lost or when PE=0.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_F/S
bits_fields.info: Master mode selection: 1: Fast mode; 0: Standard mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_DUTY
bits_fields.info: Clock HIGH duty cycle in fast mode: 1: 36%; 0: 33.3%.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_CCR
bits_fields.info: Clock frequency division factor register, which decides frequency wave of SCL clock. In I2C standard mode or SMBus mode: Thigh = CCR * THCLK, Tlow = CCR * THCLK. In I2C fast mode: If DUTY = 0: Thigh = CCR * THCLK, Tlow = 2 * CCR * THCLK. If DUTY = 1: (Speed reaches 400kHz) Thigh = 9 * CCR * THCLK, Tlow = 16 * CCR * THCLK. Example: In the standard mode, the SCL frequency of 100kHz is generated: CCR = FREQR/(2*100KHz), when FREQR = 52MHz and THCLK = 1/52MHz, CCR = 52MHz/(2*100KHz) = 260, and CCR is written in 0x104.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_I2C_TRISE
bits_fields.info: Maximum rise time. These bits set the rise time of SCL in master mode. The maximum rise time=TRISEsingle clock cycle. This bit can be set only when PE is cleared.

bits_fields.name: RB_VLCD_SEL
bits_fields.info: LCD drive voltage selection: 1: 2.5V; 0: 3.3V.

bits_fields.name: RB_SCAN_CLK_SEL
bits_fields.info: Scan clock selection: 00: 256Hz; 01: 512Hz; 10: 1KHz; 11: 128Hz.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_DUTY
bits_fields.info: LCD duty cycle selection: 00: 1/2; 01: 1/3; 10: 1/4; 11: Invalid.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_BIAS
bits_fields.info: Bias ratio selection: 1: 1/3; 0: 1/2.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_ON
bits_fields.info: LCD switch: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_SYS_EN
bits_fields.info: System enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_SEGX(X=0-7)
bits_fields.info: Data in SEG0-SEG7 segments, 4 bits per segment.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_SEGX(X=8-15)
bits_fields.info: Data in SEG8-SEG15 segments, 4 bits per segment.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_SEGX(X=16-23)
bits_fields.info: Data in SEG16-SEG23 segments, 4 bits per segment.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_SEGX(X=24-27)
bits_fields.info: Data in SEG24-SEG27 segments, 4 bits per segment.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_LCD_SEG_EN
bits_fields.info: SEG27-SEG0 segment enable, active high.

R32_IWDG_KR.name: R32_IWDG_KR
R32_IWDG_KR.info: Independent Watchdog key register. Writing specific key values to this register controls the watchdog timer operation, including starting the watchdog, refreshing the counter, and enabling register access.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: IWDG_KR
bits_fields.info: KEY[15:0]: key value (Write register only, read out value is 0x0000). The software must write 0xAAAA at certain intervals to reload the count value, otherwise, when the counter is 0, the watchdog will generate a reset, and writing 0x5555 indicates that the protection is lifted. Write 0xCCCC to start the watchdog work (If the hardware watchdog is selected, it is not restricted by this command word).

R32_IWDG_CFG.name: R32_IWDG_CFG
R32_IWDG_CFG.info: Independent Watchdog configuration register. Holds configuration bits such as prescaler and reload values that determine watchdog timeout intervals.

bits_fields.name: IWDG_EN
bits_fields.info: Watchdog start flag bit: 1: On; 0: Off.

bits_fields.name: WR_PROTECT
bits_fields.info: Write protection flag bit: 1: Turn on protection, when turned on the operation of the protected field does not take effect; 0: Unprotected.

bits_fields.name: STOP_EN
bits_fields.info: Watchdog stop enable (protected). 1: Turn on the stop switch; 0: Turn off the stop switch. Note: Valid only in debug mode.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: COUNT
bits_fields.info: Watchdog decrement counter

bits_fields.name: PVU
bits_fields.info: Watchdog configuration register update flag bit (protected): 1: Register has update; 0: Register has no update.

bits_fields.name: PR
bits_fields.info: Prescaling factor (protected). 000: Divided by 4; 001: Divided by 8; 010: Divided by 16; 011: Divided by 32; 100: Divided by 64; 101: Divided by 128; 110: Divided by 256; 111: Divided by 512.

bits_fields.name: RLR
bits_fields.info: RL[11:0]: Watchdog counter reload (protected). Used to define the reload value for the watchdog counter, which is transferred to the counter whenever 0xAAAA is written to the IWDG_KR register. The counter then counts down from this value. The watchdog timeout period can be calculated from this reload value and the clock prescaler value.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_CH_INX
bits_fields.info: ADC channel index number, a total of 14 channels: 00h-0Dh: External signal channels A0~A13; 0Eh: Battery voltage VBAT; 0Fh: Built-in temperature sensor TS. 10h: NFC energy detection channel.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_CLK_DIV
bits_fields.info: ADC clock frequency selection: When R16_CLK_SYS_CFG[9] = 1, 00: Reserved; 01: CK32M divided by 4, 8MHz; 10: CK32M divided by 6, 5.33MHz; 11: CK32M divided by 8, 4MHz. When R16_CLK_SYS_CFG[9] = 0, 00: CK16M divided by 2, 8MHz; 01: CK16M divided by 4, 4MHz; 10: CK16M divided by 6, 2.67MHz; 11: CK32M divided by 8, 2MHz. Note: ADC clock frequency supports up to 8MHz.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN
bits_fields.info: ADC input PGA gain selection: Used in conjunction with bit RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2] in register R8_ADC_CONVERT. When RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2]=0: 00: -12dB, 1/4; 01: -6dB, 1/2; 10: 0dB, 1 time, no gain; 11: 6dB, 2 times. When RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2]=1: 00: 6dB, 2 times; 01: 12dB, 4 times; 10: 18dB, 8 times; 11: 24dB, 16 times.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_OFS_TEST
bits_fields.info: ADC offset error test mode: 1: Test/calibrate mode. The lower 12-bit data of data register R16_ADC_DATA will be inverted bit by bit in test mode (0x0573 is inverted to 0x0A8C); 0: Normal mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DIFF_EN
bits_fields.info: ADC channel signal input mode: 1: Differential input; 0: Single-ended input.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_BUF_EN
bits_fields.info: ADC input buffer BUF enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_POWER_ON
bits_fields.info: ADC module power enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_EOC_X
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion end flag (UART signal): 1: Completed; 0: In progress.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SAMPLE_TIME
bits_fields.info: ADC sample period selection: 00: 4*Tadc; 01: 5*Tadc; 10: 6*Tadc; 11: 7*Tadc.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2]
bits_fields.info: ADC's input PGA gain direction selection, combined with RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[1:0] is used. Note: This bit must be 0 when using TS, i.e. RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2:0]=011b when using TS.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_START
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion enable control and status. It is cleared automatically when non-continuous ADC ends or when DMA ends: 1: Start conversion/being converted; 0: Stop conversion.

bits_fields.name: RB_TEM_SEN_PWR_ON
bits_fields.info: TS temperature sensor power enable control: 1: Enabled; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DATA
bits_fields.info: Data after ADC conversion.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_EOC
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion finished flag. This flag can be cleared by writing to register R8_ADC_CONVERT or R8_TKEY_CONVERT.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_AUTO_EN
bits_fields.info: Automatic continuous ADC sampling enable at timing interval: 1: Enable automatic ADC; 0: Disable automatic ADC.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_CONT_EN
bits_fields.info: ADC continuous conversion mode enable: 1: Enable continuous ADC; 0: Disable continuous ADC.

bits_fields.name: RB_SCAN_AUTO_TYPE
bits_fields.info: In ADC SCAN mode: 1: Continuous trigger; 0: Periodic trigger.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IE_EOC
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion completion interrupt enable: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IE_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA end interrupt enable: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DMA_LOOP
bits_fields.info: DMA address loop enable: 1: Enable address loop; 0: Disable address loop. If the DMA address loop is enabled, when the DMA address is added to the set end address, it will automatically loop to the start address that is set.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DMA_ENABLE
bits_fields.info: DMA function enable: 1: Enable DMA; 0: Disable DMA.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_END_ADC
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion completion interrupt flag, write 1 to clear or when data is taken by DMA or write to register R8_ADC_CONVERT to clear this flag: 1: ADC has been completed once; 0: Not completed.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA completion flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: DMA has been completed; 0: Not completed.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE.name: R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE
R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE.info: ADC and DMA interrupt flag register

bits_fields.name: R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE
bits_fields.info: The starting value of continuous ADC timing cycle is counted in unit of 16 system clocks and reloaded after reaching 256. Calculation: timing =(256-R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE)*16*Tsys Counts in units of 32MHz clock at the start value of continuous TKEY timing cycles. Calculation method: Timing = R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE*TCK32M (Or TCK16M).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R16_ADC_DMA_NOW
bits_fields.info: Current address of DMA data buffer. It can be used to calculate the number of conversions. Calculation: COUNT=(ADC_DMA_NOW-ADC_DMA_BEG)/2.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

R32_ADC_DMA_BEG.name: R32_ADC_DMA_BEG
R32_ADC_DMA_BEG.info: Current buffer address of DMA register

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R16_ADC_DMA_BEG
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer start address, the address must be 2-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R16_ADC_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer end address (not included), address must be 2-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH8
bits_fields.info: Channel 8 analog input channel select bit: 0000: A0; 0001: A1; 0010: A2; 0011: A3; 0100: A4; 0101: A5; 0110: A6; 0111: A7; 1000: A8; 1001: A9; 1010: A10; 1011: A11; 1100: A12; 1101: A13; 1110: Battery voltage VBAT; 1111: Built-in temperature sensor TS

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH7
bits_fields.info: Channel 7 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH6
bits_fields.info: Channel 6 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH5
bits_fields.info: Channel 5 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH4
bits_fields.info: Channel 4 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH3
bits_fields.info: Channel 3 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH2
bits_fields.info: Channel 2 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH1
bits_fields.info: Channel 1 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_SCAN_END
bits_fields.info: End of Scan Flag Bit, 1 indicates the end of scanning, this bit is cleared by writing 1 and invalid by writing 0.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_MASK_DIS
bits_fields.info: Channel enable is disabled after the ADC sampling channel is finished: 1: Disable OFF channel; 0: Enable OFF channel.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IE_SCAN_END
bits_fields.info: End-of-scan interrupt enable: 0: off; 1: On.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_SEL
bits_fields.info: Scan function selection: 0: TKEY; 1: ADC.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_NUM
bits_fields.info: Scan channel number.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH13
bits_fields.info: Channel 13 Analog Input Channel Select Bit: 0000: A0; 0001: A1; 0010: A2; 0011: A3; 0100: A4; 0101: A5; 0110: A6; 0111: A7; 1000: A8; 1001: A9; 1010: A10; 1011: A11; 1100: A12; 1101: A13; 1110: Battery voltage VBAT; 1111: Built-in temperature sensor TS.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH12
bits_fields.info: Channel 12 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH11
bits_fields.info: Channel 11 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH10
bits_fields.info: Channel 10 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH9
bits_fields.info: Channel 9 analog input channel select bit: As above

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DISCH_CNT
bits_fields.info: The number of Touch-Key discharge cycles, counting in unit of ADC clock selected by RB_ADC_CLK_DIV. Calculation: discharge time = (RB_TKEY_DISCH_CNT+1)*Tadc.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_CHARG_CNT
bits_fields.info: The number of Touch-Key charge cycle, counting in unit of ADC clock selected by RB_ADC_CLK_DIV. Calculation: charge time = (RB_TKEY_CHARG_CNT+ADC)*Tadc.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_START
bits_fields.info: TouchKey detection control and status, automatically cleared: 1: Start to detect/being converted; 0: Stop converting.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DMA_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey DMA enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_AUTO_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey auto-trigger enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_RAND_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey RAND enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_PGA_ADJ
bits_fields.info: Select the operating speed of PGA in ADC: 1: High speed but slightly larger power consumption; 0: Normal speed.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DRV_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey driver shielding enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_CURRENT
bits_fields.info: TouchKey charge current selection: 1: 60% current; 0: Rated current.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_PWR_ON
bits_fields.info: TouchKey module power enable control: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DRV_OUTEN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey multiplexed driver shields each channel enable, active high.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_HOST_MODE
bits_fields.info: USB working mode selection: 1: HOST; 0: DEVICE.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_LOW_SPEED
bits_fields.info: USB bus signal transmission rate selection: 1: 1.5Mbps; 0: 12Mbps.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_DEV_PU_EN
bits_fields.info: USB device enable and internal pull-up resistor control in USB device mode. If it is 1, USB device transmission is enabled and the internal pull-up resistor is also enabled. RB_UDP_PU_EN can replace this bit.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UC_SYS_CTRL
bits_fields.info: See the table below to configure the USB system.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_INT_BUSY
bits_fields.info: Auto pause enable before USB transmission completion interrupt flag is not cleared: 1: It will automatically pause before the interrupt flag UIF_TRANSFER is not cleared. In device mode, it will automatically respond to busy NAK. In host mode, it will automatically pause subsequent transmission; 0: Not pause.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_RESET_SIE
bits_fields.info: Software reset control of USB protocol processor: 1: Force to reset the USB protocol processor (SIE), software is needed to cleared; 0: Not reset.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_CLR_ALL
bits_fields.info: USB FIFO and interrupt flag clear: 1: Force to empty and clear; 0: Not clear.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_DMA_EN
bits_fields.info: USB DMA and DMA interrupt control: 1: Enable the DMA function and DMA interrupt; 0: Disable DMA.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_DEV_NAK
bits_fields.info: In USB device mode, receive NAK interrupt: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_MOD_1_WIRE
bits_fields.info: USB single wire mode enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: FIFO overflow interrupt: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_HST_SOF
bits_fields.info: In the USB host mode, SOF timing interrupt: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_SUSPEND
bits_fields.info: USB bus suspend or wake-up event interrupt: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_TRANSFER
bits_fields.info: USB transfer completion interrupt: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_DETECT
bits_fields.info: In USB host mode, USB device connection or disconnection event interrupt: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UDA_GP_BIT
bits_fields.info: USB general flag, user-defined.

bits_fields.name: MASK_USB_ADDR
bits_fields.info: Host mode: address of USB device currently operated; Device mode: the address of the USB itself.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SOF_PRES
bits_fields.info: SOF packet indication status in USB host mode: 1: SOF packet will be sent, and it will be automatically delayed if there are other USB data packets; 0: No SOF package is sent.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SOF_ACT
bits_fields.info: SOF packet transmission status in USB host mode: 1: SOF packet is being sent out; 0: The transmission is completed or idle.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SIE_FREE
bits_fields.info: USB protocol processor free status: 1: Free; 0: Busy, USB transmission is in progress.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_R_FIFO_RDY
bits_fields.info: USB receiver FIFO data ready status: 1: Receiver FIFO not empty; 0: Receiver FIFO empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_BUS_RESET
bits_fields.info: USB bus reset status: 1: The current USB bus is at the reset status; 0: The current USB bus is at the non-reset status.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SUSPEND
bits_fields.info: USB suspend status: 1: The USB bus is in suspended status, and there is no USB activity for a period of time; 0: USB bus is in non-suspended status.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_DM_LEVEL
bits_fields.info: In USB host mode, the level status of the DM pin when the device is just connected to the USB port, used to determine speed: 1: High level/ low-speed; 0: Low level/ full-speed.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_DEV_ATTACH
bits_fields.info: USB device connection status of the port in USB host mode: 1: The port has been connected to a USB device; 0: No USB device is connected to the port.

bits_fields.name: RB_U_IS_NAK
bits_fields.info: In USB device mode, NAK acknowledge status: 1: NAK acknowledge during current USB transmission; 0: No NAK acknowledge.

bits_fields.name: RB_U_TOG_OK
bits_fields.info: Current USB transmission DATA0/1 synchronous flag match status: 1: Synchronous; 0: Asynchronous.

bits_fields.name: RB_U_SIE_FREE
bits_fields.info: USB protocol processor idle status: 1: USB idle; 0: Busy, USB transmission is in progress.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: USB FIFO overflow interrupt flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: FIFO overflow trigger; 0: No event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_HST_SOF
bits_fields.info: SOF timing interrupt flag in USB host mode. Write 1 to reset: 1: SOF packet transmission completion trigger; 0: No event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_SUSPEND
bits_fields.info: USB bus suspend or wake-up event interrupt flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: USB suspend event or wake-up event trigger; 0: No event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_TRANSFER
bits_fields.info: USB transmission completion interrupt flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: USB transmission completion trigger; 0: No event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_BUS_RST
bits_fields.info: USB bus reset event interrupt flag in USB device mode. Write 1 to reset: 1: USB bus reset event trigger; 0: No event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIS_SETUP_ACT
bits_fields.info: In USB device mode, when this bit is 1, 8-byte SETUP request packet has been successfully received. SETUP token does not affect RB_UIS_TOG_OK, MASK_UIS_TOKEN, MASK_UIS_ENDP and R8_USB_RX_LEN.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIS_TOG_OK
bits_fields.info: Current USB transmission DATA0/1 synchronization flag matching status. The same as RB_U_TOG_OK: 1: Synchronous; 0: Asynchronous.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UIS_TOKEN
bits_fields.info: In device mode, the token PID of the current USB transfer transaction.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UIS_ENDP
bits_fields.info: In device mode, the endpoint number of the current USB transfer transaction.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UIS_H_RES
bits_fields.info: In host mode, the response PID identification of the current USB transfer transaction. 0000: the device has no response or timeout; Other values: respond PID.

bits_fields.name: R8_USB_RX_LEN
bits_fields.info: The number of data bytes received by the current USB endpoint.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R32_UEPn_DMA
bits_fields.info: Endpoint n buffer start address. The address must be 4-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R8_UEPn_T_LEN
bits_fields.info: Set the number of data bytes that USB endpoint n is ready to send.

bits_fields.name: RB_UEP_R_TOG
bits_fields.info: Expected synchronization trigger bit of the receiver (process OUT transactions) of USB endpoint n: 1: Expect DATA1; 0: Expect DATA0.

bits_fields.name: RB_UEP_T_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit of the transmitter (process IN transactions) of USB endpoint n: 1: Transmit DATA1; 0: Transmit DATA0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_UEP_AUTO_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit auto flip enable control bit: 1: After the data is sent or received successfully, the corresponding synchronization trigger bit is automatically flipped; 0: Not flipped automatically, but can be switched manually. It only supports endpoint 1/2/3/5/6/7.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UEP_R_RES
bits_fields.info: Control on the response to OUT transactions by the receiver of USB endpoint n: 00: Respond ACK; 01: Timeout/no response, used for real-time/synchronous transmission of non-endpoint 0; 10: Respond to NAK or busy; 11: Respond to STALL or error.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UEP_T_RES
bits_fields.info: Control on response to IN transactions of the transmitter of endpoint n: 00: DATA0/DATA1 data is ready and ACK is expected; 01: Respond to DATA0/DATA1 and expect no response, used for real-time/synchronous transmission of non-endpoint 0; 10: Respond to NAK or busy; 11: Respond to STALL or error.
